snippet: Critics questioned the testing standards and pointed to the one test in which a bent piece of rail pushed a driver’s door in 6.75 inches.
abstract: Federal Highway Admin releases analysis of crash tests related to potentially dangerous guardrails manufactured by Trinity Industries, issuing passing grades for guardrails in question; critics have called evaluation flawed, and while agency defends analysis and says it will continue to monitor issue, release seems to have only deepened debate.

byline.original: By AARON M. KESSLER and DANIELLE IVORY
byline.contributor: Aaron M. Kessler reported from Washington and Danielle Ivory from New York.

lead_paragraph: Critics questioned the testing standards and pointed to the one test in which a bent piece of rail pushed a driver’s door in 6.75 inches.

headline.main: Guardrails Said to Pass Safety Tests
headline.print_headline: Guardrails Said to Pass Safety Tests
